title: Building (Progressive) Web Apps - Michael Solati | JSConf China 2019
description:
Michael is a Developer Advocate at Typeform as well as a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies. He has been writing code for five years and has found his love in Angular, Firebase, Progressive Web Apps, and the voodoo ways of the web... Michael has also spoken at various meetups and conferences, including Angular NYC, Techduels, and the United Nations. Michael's dream side project is a MaaS (Memes as a Service) platform for meme delivery by mail.

title: Growing Developer Groups - GDG Academy Summit
description:
Michael Solati, Pacific Regional Mentor at GDG Berkeley and San Francisco, and Eva Sofianos, Northeast Regional Mentor at GDG Bronx, go over ways to grow your community through cross-collaboration, events, engagement, and much more.


GDG Academy Summit brings together new GDG organizers from all around to learn how to be successful in their role! Join our sessions as we discuss different ways you can improve your community.

title: Michael Solati ðŸŽ¤ Angular Elements
description:
https://nge-slides.firebaseapp.com

You write React for work, but you don't want to no mo'. You ask your boss, please? But (s)he still says, no! How about instead of missing class, you try something different? Well, the Angular team has something cool for you... Angular Elements! Angular Elements are Angular components packaged as custom elements, a web standard for defining new HTML elements in a framework-agnostic way. Learn how to write and package your Angular components to be used across any framework (or no framework) by extending HTML to allow you to define a tag whose content is created and controlled by your Angular code. Now you can put your Angular components into any other frameworks components! (You gotta fight for your right to write Angular!)

title: Scaling Angular
description: A video isn't as good as being there, attend our next event in person and get a chance to meet like minded individuals, ask questions, and hang out with the speakers! Learn more at https://fsto.co

title: Building Progressive (Web) Apps
description: Most people think if they want to build an app they must build two apps for Android or iOS. The web has become so much more powerful in what we can do, though. JavaScript frameworks allow developers to build powerful web app with a fraction of the time and resources of native apps. While tools like Ionic are allowing developers to make beautiful web apps that look and behave so much like native application with their UI and offline capabilities; so much so that users might not even tell the difference. Even cooler is now you can install apps from the web onto your phone like a native app. The web is advancing at an unprecedented rate, and you should be taking advantage of this. Learn what makes a progressive web app so progressive and some of the tooling you can use to build amazing (web) apps!

title: Building Modern Web Apps
description:
In this talk, Checkmate's Michael Solati and Robert Crowdis take a look at the differences between web apps and web sites, and build a web app all in one hour!

DevFest New Haven is Connecticut's largest conference for learning about Google tech. DevFest New Haven 2017 was organized by:


GDG New Haven | https://www.meetup.com/GDG-New-Haven/
Checkmate | https://checkmate.digital/
Southern Connecticut State University | https://www.southernct.edu/

title: Windy City DevFest 2018 - Spittin' Hot Geofire with Firebase
description:
Speaker: Michael Solati
Session: https://windycity.devfest.io/sessions/-L0GKqlijVah2Tr7XRl9

Geo-queries and location contextual information can be a massively important to any application you want to build. Wether your making an apps to find restaurants nearby, call a taxi, or swipe right on the person of your dreams, location matters! Firebase makes for an amazing tool and database service, but it doesn't support geo related queries out the box. That's ok though with some cool and fancy algorithms we can handle geo-queries in real time with Firebase.

title: michael solati and robert crowdis, College Tech Challenge Champions
description:
Michael Solati - SCSU Student, College Tech Challenge Champion
Robert Crowdis - SCSU Student, College Tech Challenge Champion

 
â€¢ The College Tech Challenge and Hiring Fair brought together the top 50 engineering and programming students in the state to compete for two $5000 cash prizes last month in Bristol.
â€¢ The event is organized by the Connecticut Technology Council, a trade association for tech businesses in Connecticut and building tech community in the state. It is the only event like it in CT.
â€¢ The overarching goal of the College Tech Challenge is to help bridge the gap between the tech talent and the tech workforce, a major goal of the Connecticut Technology Council.
â€¢ Mike and Rob won the coding challenge in which students had to use public data to create a tool to help seniors. Mike and Rob's project helps seniors find activities and meetups. They interviewed seniors to create the project which works on all devices.
â€¢ Mike and Rob are both from CT and they are interested in building their careers in CT.
â€¢ At the CT Tech Challenge Hiring Fair, Mike and Rob connected with iDevices and Tsunami Tsolutions--CT startups. They currently work part time for a startup in New Haven and are interested in working with exciting, small tech companies in CT
â€¢ Mike and Rob feel that in addition to tech jobs, a strong tech community is needed to help CT retain and attract talent. The College Tech Challenge is a great example of that community coming together.

title: AngularNYC - Scaling Apps Like The Pros! - Michael Solati
description:
Now that you've made a few components, have gotten routing figured out in your apps, it's time to step up your ng-game! Learn about the best practices and ways to make fast and large Angular applications like a pro.

COMPLEXITY LEVEL - INTERMEDIATE 

CONTENTS

0:05 - Intro
2:01 - Lighten The Load
6:37 - Routing
8:28 - Modules
10:49 - Cancel Subscriptions
11:38 - Cancel Subscriptions: Async Pipe
14:53 - Cancel Subscriptions: .first()
17:40 - Cache all the things
20:33 - Questions

Building Progressive web apps guide

title: AngularNYC - Angular CLI: Your First App - Michael Solati - 07/26/2017
description:
In this video Michael shows how to build a typical Angular app with basic functionality using CLI tools in just about 15 mins.

COMPLEXITY LEVEL - BEGINNER

CONTENTS

0:05 - Slides
3:31 - Demo
3:45 - Generate new project
4:46 - Install additional packages
5:37 - Running live server with ng serve
6:20 - Creating components
7:52 - Creating service
8:30 - Providing service

10:05 - Set up routing
11:52 - Angular Material breaking changes note

14:03 - Importing service into component

title: (Preview) What's Good Near Me?
description:
Michael Solati - (Preview) DevShop NY - February 2016

Michael gives an introduction to MongoDB's geospatial indexes and queries and shows us how to integrate them with Meteor and the Google Maps api.

Michael is a full stack developer at Checkmate Creations, a meteor web shop. "I have a passion for geo because its one of the few techs that is just a digital representation of something real and relevant to people."

Tweet him at @mkslt04 or find out more about him at www.michaelsolati.com
